description:
Move the parsing of homepage_url" and "devtools_page" out of Extension.

-Created a ManifestURLParser PKS to register the ManifestHandler
for various URL related manifest keys.
-Created a generic ManifestURL ManifestData for different URLs

This CL takes care of only "homepage_url" and "devtools_page" keys.
I will create a follow-up CL for update_url and options_url.

Patch from Joe Thomas <mhx348@motorola.com>.

BUG=159265

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=176316

messages.text:
Could you share the broader context of what is happening? It sounds like dependency injection, but the price you are paying for this it is very high.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api.h
File chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api.h (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api.h#newcode15
chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api.h:15: class DevtoolsAPI : public ProfileKeyedService {
DevToolsAPI

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api_factory.h
File chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api_factory.h (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api_factory.h#newcode15
chrome/browser/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_api_factory.h:15: class DevtoolsAPIFactory : public ProfileKeyedServiceFactory {
We use DevTools prefix (although  devtools_ in the file name).

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/common/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_page_handler.cc
File chrome/common/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_page_handler.cc (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/1/chrome/common/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_page_handler.cc#newcode40
chrome/common/extensions/api/devtools/devtools_page_handler.cc:40: Extension* extension,
poor indent

pfeldman: the context is in the design doc in the bug, specifically this part:
https://docs.google.com/a/chromium.org/document/d/1hSwqniJVtk3he1fTl_PW422_48F7ZRQUpXLDPqCmRgk/edit?pli=1#bookmark=id.7yabrn4buy5c

However, I think it's unwieldy to have a separate thing for each URL. The URLs are meaningful in different places, but it would probably be useful to have a generic ManifestData for a URL (not specific to devtools). Furthermore, we could consolidate all of the parsing of homepage_url, update_url, devtools_url, etc. into a single API.

One detail is that the renderer needs to know about the devtools URL, which means the manifest handler needs to be registered in the renderer also. ChromeContentRendererClient (probably RenderThreadStarted) is the best place I've found to do this.

@pfeldman: Thanks for the review. I will consider your review comments in the next iteration.


> However, I think it's unwieldy to have a separate thing for each URL. The URLs
> are meaningful in different places, but it would probably be useful to have a
> generic ManifestData for a URL (not specific to devtools). Furthermore, we could
> consolidate all of the parsing of homepage_url, update_url, devtools_url, etc.
> into a single API.
> 
> One detail is that the renderer needs to know about the devtools URL, which
> means the manifest handler needs to be registered in the renderer also.
> ChromeContentRendererClient (probably RenderThreadStarted) is the best place
> I've found to do this.

Sure. I will make changes as per your suggestions. Thanks.

> However, I think it's unwieldy to have a separate thing for each URL. The URLs
> are meaningful in different places, but it would probably be useful to have a
> generic ManifestData for a URL (not specific to devtools). Furthermore, we could
> consolidate all of the parsing of homepage_url, update_url, devtools_url, etc.
> into a single API.
> 
> One detail is that the renderer needs to know about the devtools URL, which
> means the manifest handler needs to be registered in the renderer also.
> ChromeContentRendererClient (probably RenderThreadStarted) is the best place
> I've found to do this.

@Yoyo:
Modified the CL as per your suggestions. Please take a look. Thanks.

You can use GURL::EmptyGURL for the missing value case.

I don't think this interface makes sense. Why not
GetDevToolsPage(extension)
GetHomepageURL(extension)
?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h#newcode24
chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h:24: static const GURL url(const Extension* extension, const URLType type);
This should be of type const GURL& to avoid making a copy.

Why is this being moved? By the way, Devlin is changing this thread safety check in

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11644057/

so it should work better.

> This should be of type const GURL& to avoid making a copy.

Since we create a temporary GURL object inside GetHomepageURL(extension) function, a reference cannot be returned for GetHomepageURL.

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc
File chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc#newcode1583
chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc:1583: finished_parsing_manifest_ = true;
On 2012/12/27 17:16:17, Yoyo Zhou wrote:
> Why is this being moved? By the way, Devlin is changing this thread safety check
> in
> 
> https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11644057/
> 
> so it should work better.

PermissionSet constructor below queries for "devtools_page" URL through PermissionSet::InitImplicitExtensionPermissions and hits DCHECK in Extension::GetManifestData. So I think it's reasonable to move this setter up as Manifest parsing is already completed. 

I will revisit this change once https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11644057/ lands and move it back.

> > This should be of type const GURL& to avoid making a copy.
> 
> Since we create a temporary GURL object inside GetHomepageURL(extension)
> function, a reference cannot be returned for GetHomepageURL.

This was my point about GURL::EmptyGURL - you can avoid a temporary.

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc
File chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc#newcode1583
chrome/common/extensions/extension.cc:1583: finished_parsing_manifest_ = true;
On 2012/12/30 04:26:00, Joe Thomas wrote:
> On 2012/12/27 17:16:17, Yoyo Zhou wrote:
> > Why is this being moved? By the way, Devlin is changing this thread safety
> check
> > in
> > 
> > https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11644057/
> > 
> > so it should work better.
> 
> PermissionSet constructor below queries for "devtools_page" URL through
> PermissionSet::InitImplicitExtensionPermissions and hits DCHECK in
> Extension::GetManifestData. So I think it's reasonable to move this setter up as
> Manifest parsing is already completed. 
> 
> I will revisit this change once https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/11644057/
> lands and move it back.

Once that lands, you should not need to change this. But your change here is not a good workaround; finished_parsing_manifest_ tells us that the extension is done being constructed and safe to read from other threads. But this is not true if the permissions haven't been set yet.

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/19001/chrome/browser/profiles/profile_dependency_manager.cc
File chrome/browser/profiles/profile_dependency_manager.cc (right):

chrome/browser/profiles/profile_dependency_manager.cc:266: <extensions::ManifestURLParser>::GetInstance();
I think it's better to break the line after the second :: if possible.

chrome/common/extensions/devtools_page_handler.h:5: #ifndef CHROME_COMMON_EXTENSIONS_DEVTOOLS_PAGE_HANDLER_H_
I think these are simple enough that it's not worth it to put each in a separate file. I prefer Devlin's approach to put them in a common extensions_url_handler.cc; see:
https://codereview.chromium.org/11742005/

chrome/common/extensions/manifest_url_info.h:16: struct ManifestURLInfo : public Extension::ManifestData {
I think you could call this just ManifestURL.

Please take a look at the latest patch. Thanks

It was showing with "D" symbol but side-by-side diff shows the modification. Not sure whether it was a bug with the system.

I corrected it by uploading the new patchset in two steps.

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h
File chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/11624036/diff/8001/chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h#newcode24
chrome/common/extensions/api/url_parser/url_info.h:24: static const GURL url(const Extension* extension, const URLType type);
On 2013/01/03 01:45:54, Yoyo Zhou wrote:
> On 2012/12/30 04:26:00, Joe Thomas wrote:
> > On 2012/12/27 17:16:17, Yoyo Zhou wrote:
> > > This should be of type const GURL& to avoid making a copy.
> > 
> > Since we create a temporary GURL object inside GetHomepageURL(extension)
> > function, a reference cannot be returned for GetHomepageURL.
> 
> This was my point about GURL::EmptyGURL - you can avoid a temporary.

If you look at ManifestURL::GetHomepageURL definition, apart from creating the EmptyURL, we need to create one more temporary GURL object with "extension_urls::GetWebstoreItemDetailURLPrefix() + extension->id()". Because of that we will not be able to return reference in that one getter function.

> > > function, a reference cannot be returned for GetHomepageURL.
> > 
> > This was my point about GURL::EmptyGURL - you can avoid a temporary.
> 
> If you look at ManifestURL::GetHomepageURL definition, apart from creating the
> EmptyURL, we need to create one more temporary GURL object with
> "extension_urls::GetWebstoreItemDetailURLPrefix() + extension->id()". Because of
> that we will not be able to return reference in that one getter function.

Oh, okay. This will be the same as the old GetHomepageURL then, so that's fine.
